title: Sinusoidal Modeling - water depth phase shift

content.question: ​The depth of water in a bay periodically increases and decreases with a period of <math alttext="12"><semantics><mn>12</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> hours. The depth of water, in feet, at a point in the bay can be modeled by a sinusoidal function <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> of time <math alttext="t"><semantics><mi>t</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, measured in hours starting at <math alttext="t equals 0"><semantics><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. The depth of water at the point is <math alttext="10"><semantics><mn>10</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> feet at time <math alttext="t equals 3"><semantics><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> hours and <math alttext="2"><semantics><mn>2</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> feet at time <math alttext="t equals 9"><semantics><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> hours. If these time-depth pairs represent a maximum value and the first minimum value after the maximum, respectively, which of the following could define <math alttext="f open parentheses t close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?

choices.label: ​<math alttext="4 cos open parentheses pi over 6 open parentheses t minus 3 close parentheses close parentheses plus 6"><semantics><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>6</mn></mfrac><mfenced><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​​<math alttext="4 cos open parentheses pi over 6 open parentheses t plus 3 close parentheses close parentheses plus 6"><semantics><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>6</mn></mfrac><mfenced><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​​<math alttext="4 sin open parentheses pi over 6 open parentheses t minus 3 close parentheses close parentheses plus 6"><semantics><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>6</mn></mfrac><mfenced><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="4 sin open parentheses pi over 6 open parentheses t plus 3 close parentheses close parentheses plus 6"><semantics><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>6</mn></mfrac><mfenced><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

content.answer: ​<math alttext="4 cos open parentheses pi over 6 open parentheses t minus 3 close parentheses close parentheses plus 6"><semantics><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>6</mn></mfrac><mfenced><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

topic.text: 3.7: Sinusoidal Function Context and Data Modeling

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
